title: Ex sent me the song Sorry by Halsey. What does this mean? - Quora

response.answer_text: I think that’s a nice sentiment, but ultimately not a sign that you are going to get back together or anything. The song seems to be about Halsey’s inability to really love anyone, so she’s saying “I’m really sorry that my own issues aren’t quite done being dealt with, and it’s made me incapable of fully appreciating you.” My take on this idea is also that she just wasn’t quite in love with this person enough to WANT to deal with her issues—I’ve always felt that even when timing isn’t perfect, you would still at least try to make it work with the “right” person, and not use timing as an excuse. It’s essentially a beautiful rendition of “it’s not you, it’s me.” And you won’t ever be able to change someone’s mind about that. If they want to be with you they have to come to that realization on their own, and your time is probably best spent focusing on things you can control. Either way, a great song—one you should definitely soak up when you’re in that mood. But I’ve found that over analyzing gestures like this just ends up with me lying to myself. Ideally, your ex would just send you a text that conveys exactly what they want. And even more ideally, what they want will align with what you want—rather than making you interpret anything.

This could possibly mean two things: He either wants to say he is sorry for screwing something up so he will have a chance to get back together, or he just wants to apologize to make up for what he did without expecting anything.
